clinical_study.brief_title: Promoting Antiretroviral Therapy Among Serodiscordant Couples to Reduce HIV Transmission
clinical_study.official_title: A Cluster-randomized Controlled Trial of Promoting Antiretroviral Therapy Among Serodiscordant Couples to Reduce HIV Transmission

lead_sponsor.agency: National Center for AIDS/STD Control and Prevention, China CDC

clinical_study.source: National Center for AIDS/STD Control and Prevention, China CDC

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of reducing HIV transmission among sero-discordant couples by applying comprehensive intervention components.

detailed_description.textblock: A cluster-randomized controlled trial was carried out in forty counties from 16 cities. The strategy of Social Marketing was applied to influence sero-discordant couples' behavioral changes including safer sexual intercourses, regular HIV testing for the negative partners, antiretroviral therapy initiation.

primary_outcome.measure: HIV seroconversion rate of HIV negatives among HIV serodiscordant couples

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of HIV positives receiving ART among HIV serodiscordant couples
The incidence rate of AIDS-related diseases of HIV positives among serodiscordant couples

arm_group.description: According the National HIV Antiretroviral treatment Guideline, provide treatment referrals for those treatment-eligible HIV-positive patients.

intervention.description: ART promotion, Couple testing and consulting promotion, and Condom use promotion
